snippet: The late Nobel laureate was revered by free-market enthusiasts who saw his arguments as favoring limited government. But an economist says their perspective was mistaken.
abstract: Robert H Frank Economic View column holds notes that late Nobel laureate in economics Ronald H Coase is revered by free-market enthusiasts who see his arguments as favoring limited government; contends, however, that that view of his work is profoundly mistaken, and in time his framework will instead be seen as providing not only best explanation for why governments regulate in ways they do, but also best advice on how they might regulate more effectively.
lead_paragraph: The late Nobel laureate was revered by free-market enthusiasts who saw his arguments as favoring limited government. But an economist says their perspective was mistaken.

headline.print_headline: A Pragmatic Voice For Government’s Role
headline.main: Ronald Coase, a Pragmatic Voice for Government’s Role
